name: tawdry
content:
tawdry adjective
(LOW QUALITY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
looking bright and attractive but in fact cheap and of low quality: Their ugly front garden and tacky, tawdry lights fail to reflect our village image. A lot of the city's housing consists of nondescript houses and some districts are downright tawdry. Synonym
gimcrack disapprovingCompare
garish disapproving
More examplesFewer examplesThe tawdry glitter of the fairground is contrasted with the lovers in the shadows.She found dressing-gowns and slippers so tawdry.The stark lighting bathes the audience in a harsh, eye-punishing glare that makes the theater's seats and carpeting look strangely tawdry.

(IMMORAL)
showing or having low moral standards: She humiliated her husband with her tawdry affair. tawdry revelations about his visits to prostitutes
